file.name: openapi.yml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.1
info:
  title: absenceManagement
  description: >-
    This is a generated connector for [WorkDay AbsenceManagement REST API v1](https://community.workday.com/sites/default/files/file-hosting/restapi/index.html) OpenAPI specification.

    The Absence Management service enables applications to access worker information about leaves of absence and time off details.
  x-ballerina-init-description: >
    The connector initialization requires setting the API credentials. 
 
    Follow [this guide] https://credentials.workday.com/docs/authentication/ and obtain tokens.
  x-ballerina-display:
    label: Workday Absence Management
    iconPath: "icon.png"
  version: v1
# Apply the security globally to all operations
security:
  - bearerAuth: [] 
tags:
  - name: balances
    description: Provides the ability to get absence plan and leave of absence balances.
  - name: workers
    description: >-
      Retrieves staffing information about workers. This resource also provides
      the ability to create, update, delete, and archive check-ins and check-in
      topics.
  - name: Prompt Values
    description: >-
      Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint
      parameters in this service.
paths:
  /workers/{id}/leavesOfAbsence/{subresourceID}:
    get:
      tags:
        - workers
      summary: Retrieves the leave of absence for the specified worker.
      operationId: retrieveWorkerLeaveOfAbsence
      description: >-
        Retrieves information about the leave of absence for the worker with the
        specified ID.


        Secured by: Worker Data: Leave of Absence, Self-Service: Leave of
        Absence


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the resource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: subresourceID
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the subresource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: >-
                  #/components/schemas/LeavesOfAbsenceView
        '400':
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '401':
          description: >-
            Invalid resource or operation.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '403':
          description: >-
            User has insufficient permissions.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '404':
          description: >-
            Resource not found.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /values/leave/status/:
    get:
      tags:
        - Prompt Values
      summary: >-
        Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint
        parameters in this service.
      operationId: retrievesInstanceAsValuesForEndpointParameters
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            'application/json':
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/MULTIPLE_INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            'application/json':
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /balances/{id}:
    get:
      tags:
        - balances
      summary: >-
        Retrieves the specified balance of all absence plan and leave of absence
        types.
      operationId: retrieveAbsencePlaneBalance
      description: >-
        Retrieves the specified balance of all absence plan and leave of absence
        types for the specified balance ID. You can use a returned id from GET
        /balances.


        Secured by: Worker Data: Time Off (Time Off Balances), Worker Data: Time
        Off (Time Off Balances Manager View), Self-Service: Time Off Balances,
        Worker Data: Leave of Absence, Self-Service: Leave of Absence
        Entitlements


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the resource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: >-
                  #/components/schemas/AbsenceBalanceView
        '400':
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '401':
          description: >-
            Invalid resource or operation.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '403':
          description: >-
            User has insufficient permissions.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '404':
          description: >-
            Resource not found.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /values/timeOff/status/:
    get:
      tags:
        - Prompt Values
      summary: >-
        Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint
        parameters in this service.
      operationId: retrievesTimeOffInstancesForEndpointParameters
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            'application/json':
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/MULTIPLE_INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            'application/json':
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /workers/{id}/eligibleAbsenceTypes:
    get:
      tags:
        - workers
      summary: >-
        Retrieves a collection of eligible absence types for the specified
        worker.
      operationId: retrievesCollectionOfAbsenceTypes
      description: >-
        Retrieves all the eligible absence types for the specified worker ID for
        a category type. If you don't specify a query parameter, this will get
        all time off types, absence tables, and leave types a worker is eligible
        for.


        Specify the category to filter the result based on absence type.


        Secured by: Request Leave of Absence (REST Service), Request Time Off
        (REST Service)


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the resource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: category
          in: query
          description: |-
            The Workday ID of the absence type category. Valid values:
            * Leave of Absence Type: 17bd6531c90c100016d74f8dfae007d0 

            * Absence Table: 17bd6531c90c100016da3f5b554007d2

            * Time Off: 17bd6531c90c100016d4b06f2b8a07ce
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: effective
          in: query
          description: >-
            The effective date for which eligible absence types need to be
            returned for the worker.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date
        - name: limit
          in: query
          description: >-
            The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is
            20. The maximum is 100.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
        - name: offset
          in: query
          description: >-
            The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
            The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control
            paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset
            is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with
            the 10th object.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: >-
                        #/components/schemas/EligibleAbsenceTypeView
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        '400':
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '401':
          description: >-
            Invalid resource or operation.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '403':
          description: >-
            User has insufficient permissions.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '404':
          description: >-
            Resource not found.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /workers/{id}/leavesOfAbsence:
    get:
      tags:
        - workers
      summary: Retrieves the Leaves Of Absence for a specified worker ID.
      operationId: retrievesLeavesOfAbsenceByWorkerID
      description: >-
        Retrieves Leaves Of Absence for a specified worker ID for a date range,
        status, and type. If you don't specify query parameters, this method
        returns all Leaves Of Absence.


        If you specify a date range, this method returns Leaves Of Absence
        events based on First Day Of Leave, Estimated Last Day Of Leave, and
        Actual Last Day Of Leave. The Actual Last Day Of Leave is used only if
        the Request Return from Leave business process is completed, else the
        Actual Last Day Of Leave is assumed to be blank. In particular, this
        method:


        * Returns an event if the Actual Last Day Of Leave is blank and the
        Estimated Last Day Of Leave is in the past but before the fromDate or
        toDate parameters.


        * Does not return an event if the Actual Last Day Of Leave is blank and
        the Estimated Last Day Of Leave is in the future but before the fromDate
        or toDate parameters.


        Secured by: Worker Data: Leave of Absence, Self-Service: Leave of
        Absence


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the resource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: fromDate
          in: query
          description: The start of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date
        - name: leaveType
          in: query
          description: >-
            The Workday ID of the type of Leave Of Absence. You can specify
            multiple leaveType query parameters.
          style: form
          explode: true
          schema:
            type: array
            items:
              type: string
        - name: limit
          in: query
          description: >-
            The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is
            20. The maximum is 100.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
        - name: offset
          in: query
          description: >-
            The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
            The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control
            paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset
            is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with
            the 10th object.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
        - name: status
          in: query
          description: >-
            The Workday ID of the status of the Leave Of Absence. The valid
            statuses are Successfully Completed, In Progress, Canceled,
            Rescinded, and Process Terminated. To get the Workday ID of a
            status, call the GET /values/leave/status endpoint. You can specify
            multiple status query parameters.
          style: form
          explode: true
          schema:
            type: array
            items:
              type: string
        - name: toDate
          in: query
          description: The end of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: >-
                        #/components/schemas/LeavesOfAbsenceView
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        '400':
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '401':
          description: >-
            Invalid resource or operation.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '403':
          description: >-
            User has insufficient permissions.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '404':
          description: >-
            Resource not found.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /balances:
    get:
      tags:
        - balances
      summary: >-
        Retrieves the balance of all absence plan and leave of absence type for
        the specified worker ID.
      operationId: retrievesBalanacesAllAbasencePalnbyWorkerID
      description: >-
        Retrieves the balance of all absence plan and leave of absence type for
        the specified worker ID.

        You can filter the balances by category, effective date, and worker.

        Specify category to filter the result based on absence type.


        There are 3 category types:


        * Leave of Absence Type, WID=17bd6531c90c100016d74f8dfae007d0 


        * Absence Table, WID=17bd6531c90c100016da3f5b554007d2


        * Time Off, WID=7bd6531c90c100016d4b06f2b8a07ce


        Secured by: Worker Data: Time Off (Time Off Balances), Worker Data: Time
        Off (Time Off Balances Manager View), Self-Service: Time Off Balances,
        Worker Data: Leave of Absence, Self-Service: Leave of Absence
        Entitlements


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: category
          in: query
          description: The Workday ID of the Time Off, Leave Type, or Absence Table.
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: effective
          in: query
          description: >-
            Absence balances as of the specified date using the yyyy-mm-dd
            format.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date
        - name: limit
          in: query
          description: >-
            The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is
            20. The maximum is 100.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
        - name: offset
          in: query
          description: >-
            The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
            The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control
            paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset
            is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with
            the 10th object.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
        - name: worker
          in: query
          description: The Workday ID of the worker for which balances are returned.
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: >-
                        #/components/schemas/AbsenceBalanceView
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        '400':
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '401':
          description: >-
            Invalid resource or operation.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '403':
          description: >-
            User has insufficient permissions.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '404':
          description: >-
            Resource not found.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /workers/{id}/requestTimeOff:
    post:
      tags:
        - workers
      summary: >-
        Creates a time off request for the specified worker ID and initiates the
        business process.
      operationId: createsTimeOffRequest
      description: >-
        Creates a time off request for the specified worker ID and initiates the
        Request Time Off business process. 


        In the request body, if using business process parameters, specify at
        least the required field: action {id}. You must specify the submit
        action WID: d9e4223e446c11de98360015c5e6daf6


        Secured by: Request Time Off (REST Service)


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the resource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      requestBody:
        description: Request payload
        content:
          'application/json':
            schema:
              $ref: >-
                #/components/schemas/TimeOffRequestEventView
        required: true
      responses:
        '201':
          description: Resource created.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: >-
                  #/components/schemas/TimeOffRequestEventView
        '400':
          description: >-
            Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

            Error Code | Validation Message

            --- | ---

            A1011 | You don't have a sufficient balance or aren't eligible to
            satisfy the request for [type] as of [date].

            A1023 | [absence REST API increment warning time off error message]

            A1014 | [absence REST API min warning time off error message]

            A1021 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Reason Not Valid for
            Time Off]

            A1028 | Some of the start and end times you're trying to submit
            overlap with existing time blocks. Edit your start and end times so
            that they don't overlap.

            A221 | The attachment category isn't enabled for this business
            process.

            A1022 | [absence REST API max critical time off error message]

            A205 | You don't have the security permission on this business
            process to add attachments.

            A1009 | Type is required and must have a value.

            A178 | The business process has already been initiated.

            A1017 | Daily Quantity is required and must have a value.

            A1015 | [absence REST API max unpaid critical time off error
            message]

            A1034 | Requires Start Time

            A1038 | Date is required and must have a value.

            A165 | The attachment category is invalid for this business process.

            A1033 | [REST Validation Message - Invalid Days Included]

            A1016 | Enter an hourly or daily quantity that is greater than zero.

            A228 | [customer event validation message]

            A200 | Commenting isn't enabled for this business process.

            A1027 | [absence REST API consecutive day maximum critical time off
            error message]

            A1019 | [absence REST API multiple time offs warning time off error
            message]

            A219 | The business process action isn't valid.

            A1040 | [absence REST API max warning time off error message]

            A206 | Attachments are not enabled for this business process.

            A1008 | Some of the start and end times you're trying to submit
            overlap with start and end times for an existing time off request on
            the same date(s). Edit your start and end times so that they don't
            overlap.

            A1050 | [REST Validation Message - Position Needed for Position
            Based/Required Time Off]

            A1007 | [absence REST API consecutive day minimum warning time off
            error message]

            A1041 | [REST Validation Message - Worker Not Eligible for Time Off
            Type]

            A1032 | You can't have multiple entries for the same Time Off Type
            for a given date.

            A1026 | [REST Validation Message - Position Not Eligible for Time
            Off Type]

            A1012 | Requires End Time

            A1037 | [absence REST API beyond last override warning time off
            error message]

            A1044 | When the Time Off Type is an Absence Table, ensure that the
            Position field is blank.

            A1039 | [absence REST API consecutive day maximum warning time off
            error message]

            A1048 | Your request includes days that aren't allowed for [Time Off
            Type]. To include the invalid days, provide a different Time Off
            Type. Otherwise, enter valid dates.

            A1043 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Reason Not Enabled for
            Time Off]

            A1042 | [absence REST API multiple time offs critical time off error
            message]

            A1025 | [absence REST API consecutive day minimum critical time off
            error message]

            A1052 | [absence REST API beyond last override critical time off
            error message]

            A1030 | [REST Validation Message - Position Provided for Worker
            Based Time Off]

            A1029 | Enter an End Time that is after the Start Time.

            A1047 | The dates for the Start and End fields must match the Date
            field: [date].

            A1020 | The request can't have a Total Hourly or Daily Quantity of
            zero.

            A1046 | Start Time and End Time are optional for [Time Off Type].
            Enter both values or neither.

            A175 | The file is required.

            A1006 | [absence REST API max unpaid warning time off error message]

            A1018 | [absence REST API increment critical time off error message]

            A1045 | [absence REST API min critical time off error message]

            A211 | The attachment category is required.

            A1036 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Reason Required But Not
            Provided]

            A207 | You've exceeded the attachment file size limit of [tenant
            setup attachment limit]KB.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '401':
          description: >-
            Invalid resource or operation.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '403':
          description: >-
            User has insufficient permissions.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '404':
          description: >-
            Resource not found.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
      x-codegen-request-body-name: timeOffRequestEventView
  /workers/{id}/validTimeOffDates/{subresourceID}:
    get:
      tags:
        - workers
      summary: Retrieves the valid time off dates for the specified worker.
      operationId: retrievesValidTimeOffDates
      description: >-
        Retrieves information about the valid time off dates for the worker with
        the specified ID.


        Secured by: Request Time Off (REST Service)


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the resource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: subresourceID
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the subresource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: >-
                  #/components/schemas/DailyQuantityView
        '400':
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '401':
          description: >-
            Invalid resource or operation.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        '403':
          description: >-
            User has insufficient permissions.
            (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:

  /workers/{id}/timeOffDetails:
    get:
      tags:
        - workers
      summary: Retrieves a collection of time off details for the specified worker.
      operationId: retrievesWorkerTimeOffDetails
      description: >-
        Retrieves the Time Off Entries for the specified worker ID. You can
        filter by date range, status, and type. If you don't specify query
        parameters, this method returns all Time Off Entries.


        Secured by: Worker Data: Time Off (Time Off), Worker Data: Time Off
        (Time Off Manager View), Self-Service: Time Off


        Scope: Time Off and Leave
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          description: The Workday ID of the resource.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: fromDate
          in: query
          description: The start of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date
        - name: limit
          in: query
          description: >-
            The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is
            20. The maximum is 100.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
        - name: offset
          in: query
          description: >-
            The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
            The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control
            paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset
            is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with
            the 10th object.
          schema:
            type: integer
            format: int64
        - name: status
          in: query
          description: >-
            The Workday ID of the time off status. You can specify multiple
            status query parameters. This method returns the most recent
            instance of a time off entry based on this query parameter. 


            The valid statuses are Approved, Submitted, Not Submitted, and Sent
            Back. This method does not return Canceled and Denied Time Off
            Entries. To get the Workday ID of a status, call the GET
            /values/timeOff/status endpoint. You can specify multiple status
            query parameters.


            Example:

            An approved Time Off Entry for Vacation 8 hours was corrected to
            Vacation 4 hours and is not in submitted status. If the query
            parameter is status = approved, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 8
            hours, Approved is returned. If query parameter status = submitted,
            the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 4 hours, Submitted is returned. If
            no query parameter is passed, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 4
            hours, Submitted is returned.
          style: form
          explode: true
          schema:
            type: array
            items:
              type: string
        - name: timeOffType
          in: query
          description: >-
            The Workday ID of the Time Off Type. You can specify multiple
            timeOffType query parameters.
          style: form
          explode: true
          schema:
            type: array
            items:
              type: string
        - name: toDate
          in: query
          description: The end of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.
          schema:
            type: string
            format: date
      responses:
        '200':
          description: >-
            Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: >-
                        #/components/schemas/TimeOffDetailsView
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        '400':
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'

  securitySchemes:
    bearerAuth:            # arbitrary name for the security scheme

  schemas:
    INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE:
      required:
        - id

      properties:
        id:
          pattern: ^(?:(?:[0-9a-f]{32})|(?:[0-9]+\$[0-9]+)|(\S+=\S+))$

          description: wid / id / reference id
        descriptor:
          type: string

          readOnly: true
        href:
          type: string
          description: A link to the instance
          readOnly: true

      required:

      properties:

          type: string
          description: A description of the error

      allOf:
        - $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        - type: object
          properties:
            errors:
              type: array
              description: An array of validation errors
              items:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
    FACETS_MODEL_REFERENCE:
      type: array
      items:
        type: object
        properties:
          descriptor:
            type: string
            description: A description of the facet
          facetParameter:
            type: string
            description: The alias used to select the facet
          values:
            type: array
            description: the facet values
            items:
              required:
                - id
              type: object
              properties:
                count:
                  type: integer

                  format: int32
                id:
                  pattern: ^(?:(?:[0-9a-f]{32})|(?:[0-9]+\$[0-9]+)|(\S+=\S+))$
                  type: string
                  description: wid / id / reference id
                descriptor:
                  type: string
                  description: A description of the facet

        readOnly: true
